page.title: 07SOME HISTORICAL RUINS
page.content: Castle Knowe is a mound in a field owned by a farmer called Mr Mitchell. We have heard that Robert the Bruce lived in the castle for a short time. The ruins of the castle cause problems for Mr Mitchell because the yew trees, that mark the site of the castle are poisonous to livestock. The areas are fenced off but are obstacles to cultivating and harvesting machinery. We found out from the New Statistical Account (about 1830) that it was originally a strong-hold of the Earl of Fife but was dismantled by the English in the 14th Century. Also on Mr Mitchells land is a Doocot which was used for pigeons (especially for messenger pigeons) but is not used now. It is also an obstacle to cultivation and is made of sandstone and whinstone.
